dt: {bc}to increase or improve in value, quality, desirability, or attractiveness

et: Middle English {it}enhauncen{/it}, from Anglo-French {it}enhaucer, enhauncer{/it}, from Vulgar Latin {it}*inaltiare{/it}, from Latin {it}in{/it} + {it}altus{/it} high {ma}{mat|old|}{/ma}
shortdef: heighten, increase; especially : to increase or improve in value, quality, desirability, or attractiveness

dt: {bc}the act or process of improving or {d_link|enhancing|enhance} oneself or one's self-esteem

dt.t: These dermatologic procedures are becoming viewed by men as a method of {wi}self-enhancement{/wi}, like eating well, wearing nice clothes or going to the gym.
The study is the first to establish a cause-and-effect link between thinking positively about oneself ({wi}self-enhancement{/wi}) and psychological wellbeing.

shortdef: the act or process of improving or enhancing oneself or one's self-esteem
